maml:description.maml:para: Gets the size of a directory without following any symbolic links or mount points.

Properties include aggregated size of a folder along with some additional properties such as: Directory File Hidden Count Total: is the total number of enumerated objects. Directory: is the total number of folders. File: is the total number of files. File is considered when object is neither Directory nor ReparsePoint. Size: is the total size(bytes) of enumerated objects. Count: the total number of Files + folders in a given folder.
The target directory.This value can be a relative or an aboslute path
Enumerates files and folders in sub-directories

Suppress any Exception that might be thrown as a result from a failure, such as ACLs protected directories or non-accessible reparse points. Note: using this switch might result in an incorrect directory size.
The target directory.This value can be a relative or an aboslute path
Enumerates files and folders in sub-directories

Suppress any Exception that might be thrown as a result from a failure, such as ACLs protected directories or non-accessible reparse points. Note: using this switch might result in an incorrect directory size.
Specify the unit type for folder size : ('KB', 'MB', 'GB', 'TB', 'PB', 'Bytes' )
Specify this parameter to list the sizes of the subfolders including the parent

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-LongDirectorySize -Path c:\temp
Path Size Directory File Hidden Count ---- ---- --------- ---- ------ ----- c:\temp 49337903 35 67 0 102

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the directory statistics for c:\temp. Since the Unit size parameter was not specified the size of the folder is in "bytes".

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-LongDirectorySize -Path c:\temp -Recurse
-ContinueonError
Path Size Directory File Hidden Count
c:\temp 7855289946 2084 4978 18 7062

dev:remarks.maml:para: List the aggregate size of all the files and folders in the temp directory, and will ignore any exceptions\errors that may arise due to access or other issues. Warning: using the -ContinueonError may result in an incorrect directory size.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-LongDirectorySize -Path c:\temp -Recurse -IncludeSubfolder -Unit MB
Path Size Directory File Hidden Count
c:\temp 7491 2084 4978 18 7062
c:\temp\.vscode 0 0 2 0 2
c:\temp\123 0 3 0 0 3
c:\temp\234 0 2 1 0 3
c:\temp\alpha1 1 4 7 0 11

dev:remarks.maml:para: Recursively list the total size of the temp folder along with the sizes of all the subfolders. The size of the folders are calulated in megabytes.

maml:description.maml:para: Deletes specified item.
The Remove-LongItem cmdlet deletes filesystem items.
Specifies a path to the items being removed. Wildcards are NOT permitted. The parameter name ("-Path") is optional.
Deletes the items in the specified locations and in all child items of the locations.
Allows the cmdlet to remove items that cannot otherwise be changed, such as read-only files.
Specifies a path to the items being removed. Wildcards are NOT permitted. The parameter name ("-Path") is optional.
Deletes the items in the specified locations and in all child items of the locations.
Allows the cmdlet to remove items that cannot otherwise be changed, such as read-only files.
This cmdlet does not return any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command deletes a file that is read-only. It uses the Path parameter to specify the file. It uses the Force parameter to give permission to delete it. Without Force, you cannot delete read-only files.
This command deletes the folder 'filenames' including all files and sub-folders.

maml:description.maml:para: Move file\folders
Moves an item from one location to another.
Specifies the path to the current location of the item.Wildcards are NOT permitted.
Specifies the path to the location where the items are being moved.
Allows the cmdlet to move an item that writes over an existing read-only item
Specifies the path to the current location of the item.Wildcards are NOT permitted.
Specifies the path to the location where the items are being moved.
Allows the cmdlet to move an item that writes over an existing read-only item
This cmdlet does not return any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command moves the Test.txt file from the C:\temp to the C:\Temp\folder1 directory and renames it from "test.txt" to "tst.txt".

This command moves the C:\Temp\logfiles directory and its contents to the C:\temp\newLogfiles directory. The logfiles directory, and all of its subdirectories and files, then appear in the newLogfiles directory.

This command moves all of the csv files from the c:\temp directory and all subdirectories, recursively, to the C:\temp\logs directory.
The command uses the Get-LongChildItem cmdlet to get all of the child items in the temp directory and its subdirectories that have a *.csv file name extension. It uses the Recurse parameter to make the retrieval recursive and the filter parameter to limit the retrieval to *.csv files.
The pipeline operator (|) sends the results of this command to Move-LongItem, which moves the csv files to the logs directory.
If files being moved to C:\temp\logs have the same name, Move-LongItem displays an warning and continues, but it moves only one file with each name to C:\temp\logs. The other files remain in their original directories.
If the logs directory (or any other element of the destination path) does not exist, the command fails. The missing directory is not created for you, even if you use the Force parameter.

maml:description.maml:para: Maps network drive
Map a network share to a local drive
The name of a local device\drive to be redirected, such as "F:". Note: you may omit the ':' in the drive letter, e.g. F
The network resource to connect to. The string can be up to MAX_PATH characters in length.
The name of a local device\drive to be redirected, such as "F:". Note: you may omit the ':' in the drive letter, e.g. F
The network resource to connect to. The string can be up to MAX_PATH characters in length.
An instance of PSCredential which provides credentials for password-based authentication used to gain access to network resources that are restricted.
The name of a local device\drive to be redirected, such as "F:". Note: you may omit the ':' in the drive letter, e.g. F
The network resource to connect to. The string can be up to MAX_PATH characters in length.
An instance of PSCredential which provides credentials for password-based authentication used to gain access to network resources that are restricted.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Maps the network share named share1 to the local drive Z:
the credential parameter is used to pass alternate credentials to access the network share "share1" and map it to drive F:
the get-credential cmdlet is used to store credentials in the variable 'cred' the cred variable is then passed to the credential parameter in Mount-LongShare to map Share1 to Drive G:

maml:description.maml:para: Copies an item from one location to another.
The Copy-LongItem cmdlet copies an item from one location to another location in the filesystem provider.
Specifies the path to the items to copy.
Specifies the path to the new location. To rename a copied item, include the new name in the value.
Allows the cmdlet to copy items that cannot otherwise be changed, such as copying over an existing file or directory.
The copy operation is performed using unbuffered I/O, bypassing system I/O cache resources. Recommended for very large file transfers.
An attempt to copy an encrypted file will succeed even if the destination copy cannot be encrypted.
Specifies the path to the items to copy.
Specifies the path to the new location. To rename a copied item, include the new name in the value.
Allows the cmdlet to copy items that cannot otherwise be changed, such as copying over an existing file or directory.
The copy operation is performed using unbuffered I/O, bypassing system I/O cache resources. Recommended for very large file transfers.
An attempt to copy an encrypted file will succeed even if the destination copy cannot be encrypted.

Specify whether the destination is a file or a folder. If this parameter is not specified the destination type is inferred by checking whether the destination item has an extension or not. If the destination has an extension then we assume it is a file and folder if not. As you can tell this is not always correct because there can be folders with a period in them which can then be incorrectly inferred as a file. Hence it is important to specify this parameter to get accurate results.
This cmdlet does not return any output.

maml:alert.maml:para: Copy-LongItem is like the 'cp' or 'copy' commands in other shells. By default the recurse flag is set so a folder copy operation is always recursive.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command copies the drivers.txt file to the C:\temp\folder1 directory. 'folder1' is created if it dosent exist.
This command copies the contents of the folder C:\Logfiles directory recursively to the C:\temp\newLogs directory. It creates the "newLogs" subdirectory if it does not already exist.
Note: the "\" at the end of the c:\temp\logfiles ensures that we copy the contents of the folder and not the folder itself.
This command copies the entire folder C:\Logfiles recursively to the C:\temp\newLogs. It creates the "newLogs" subdirectory if it does not already exist.
attempts to copy the iso file using unbuffered I/O.(Recommended for very large file transfers.)

command:example.maml:title: EXAMPLE 5
command:example.dev:code:
$params = @{ Path = 'C:\temp\test-psalphafs\source\file-01.txt' Destination = 'C:\temp\test-psalphafs\destination.dir1' Force = $false verbose = $true destinationtype = 'Directory' }
Copy-LongItem @params

dev:remarks.maml:para: We use "splatting" to pass the parameters as a table to copy-longitem. file 'file-01.txt' is copied to destination directory 'destination.dir1'. The destination directory 'destination.dir1' will be created if it dosent already exist.

Note: The destination "destination.dir1" is a folder containing a period in its name and hence we also specify the "destinationtype" parameter. If destinationtype parameter is not specified the destination would be treated as a file.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the items and child items in one or more specified locations.

The Get-LongChildItem cmdlet gets the items in one or more specified locations. If the item is a container, it gets the items inside the container, known as child items. You can use the Recurse parameter to get items in all child containers.
Specifies a path to one or more locations. Wildcards are NOT permitted. The default location is the current directory. Path can be relative or absolute.

The value of this parameter qualifies the Path parameter. Filters are more efficient than other parameters, because the provider applies them when retrieving the objects, rather than having Windows PowerShell filter the objects after they are retrieved.
Gets the items in the specified locations and in all child items of the locations.
Gets only the specified items. The value of this parameter qualifies the Path parameter. Enter a path element or pattern, such as "*.txt". Wildcards are permitted.
Omits the specified items. The value of this parameter qualifies the Path parameter. Enter a path element or pattern, such as "*.txt". Wildcards are permitted.
Gets only the container items in the locations omitting all files.In other words lists only folders and not files.
Gets only the file items in the locations omitting all container\directory items.
Gets only the names of the items in the locations. If you pipe the output of this command to another command, only the item names are sent.
When this switch is used the enumeration will skip over any symboliclinks in the path.
Specifies a path to one or more locations. Wildcards are NOT permitted. The default location is the current directory. Path can be relative or absolute.

The value of this parameter qualifies the Path parameter. Filters are more efficient than other parameters, because the provider applies them when retrieving the objects, rather than having Windows PowerShell filter the objects after they are retrieved.
Gets the items in the specified locations and in all child items of the locations.
Gets only the specified items. The value of this parameter qualifies the Path parameter. Enter a path element or pattern, such as "*.txt". Wildcards are permitted.
Omits the specified items. The value of this parameter qualifies the Path parameter. Enter a path element or pattern, such as "*.txt". Wildcards are permitted.
Gets only the container items in the locations omitting all files.In other words lists only folders and not files.
Gets only the file items in the locations omitting all container\directory items.
Gets only the names of the items in the locations. If you pipe the output of this command to another command, only the item names are sent.
When this switch is used the enumeration will skip over any symboliclinks in the path.
You can pipe a string that contains a path to Get-LongChildItem.
For more information see: http://alphafs.alphaleonis.com/doc/2.0/api/html/C308A5E5.htm
If you use the Name parameter, Get-ChildItem returns the object names as strings.

maml:alert.maml:para:
You can also refer to Get-LongChildItem by its built-in aliases "ldir", and "lgci". For more information, see about_Aliases.
Get-LongChildItem gets hidden items by default.
The Get-LongChildItem cmdlet is designed to work with the data exposed by the AlphaFS Filesystem provider and will NOT work with any other providers E.g.,Registry,Certificates etc
For more information, see (http://alphafs.alphaleonis.com/doc/2.0/api/html/7C1374.htm).

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-LongChildItem -Path C:\temp -Filter d*.txt -Recurse
Directory: C:\temp
Mode LastWriteTime Length Name ---- ------------- ------ ---- File 6/27/2015 11:44 AM 1488 drivers.txt File 7/3/2015 12:30 PM 72 dupes.txt
Directory: C:\temp\folder4\DSC06252
Mode LastWriteTime Length Name ---- ------------- ------ ---- File 8/23/2015 6:24 PM 93 dupes.txt

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all of the files that begin with the letter 'd' followed by any character(s) but end with the extension 'TXT' in the path directory and its subdirectories. The Recurse parameter directs Windows PowerShell to get objects recursively, and it indicates that the subject of the command is the specified directory and its contents.
This command lists the .txt files in the temp directory, except for those whose names start with the letter A or C or E.
This command gets only the names of all Text files that begin with 'about' in the C:\windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell directory and its subdirectories.
This command gets only the names of all directories in the C:\temp directory and its subdirectories.
This command gets all files and folders recursively. The output is then piped to Where-object which displays only those files whose length exceeds the windows API 260 character length limitation.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 6 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-LongChildItem -Path D:\Temp
Directory: D:\Temp
Mode LastWriteTime Length Name ---- ------------- ------ ---- Directory 12/5/2016 9:44 PM 123 File 12/23/2016 2:46 PM 9491 temp.ps1 SymLink-f 12/7/2016 7:21 PM 0 MySymLinkFile.txt SymLink-f 12/17/2016 12:38 PM 0 MySymLinkFile2.txt SymLink-d 12/17/2016 12:47 PM symfolder1 SymLink-d 12/17/2016 12:49 PM symfolder2 File 12/25/2016 2:10 AM 4405 test.ps1 File 12/11/2016 1:52 PM 3 testfile1.txt Directory 12/11/2016 2:26 PM testmodule File 12/11/2016 2:02 PM 3 thirdfile.txt

dev:remarks.maml:para: The mode property now shows whether a file or folder is a symlink(symboliclink) and additionaly indicates whether the type is a file or a directory

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 7 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-LongChildItem -Path D:\Temp -SkipSymbolicLink
Directory: D:\Temp
Mode LastWriteTime Length Name ---- ------------- ------ ---- Directory 12/5/2016 9:44 PM 123 File 12/23/2016 2:46 PM 9491 temp.ps1 File 12/25/2016 2:10 AM 4405 test.ps1 File 12/11/2016 1:52 PM 3 testfile1.txt Directory 12/11/2016 2:26 PM testmodule File 12/11/2016 2:02 PM 3 thirdfile.txt

dev:remarks.maml:para: lists all items in d:\temp with the exception of symboliclinks
gets items from the folder 'testdir' located in c:\temp

maml:description.maml:para: List local and mapped drives on the local machine along with their size,freespace and usedspace.
Includes size percentage as well.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-LongDiskDrive
DriveLetter VolumeLabel FileSystem DriveType FreePercent UsedPercent Free Used Size ----------- ----------- ---------- --------- ----------- ----------- ---- ---- ---- A:\ Unknown Removable 0.00% 0.00% 0 B 0 B 0 B C:\ NTFS Fixed 19.83% 80.17% 9.84 GB 39.81 GB 49.66 GB D:\ Source NTFS Fixed 32.67% 67.33% 6.53 GB 13.46 GB 20 GB E:\ Pagefile NTFS Fixed 98.75% 1.25% 9.87 GB 128.41 MB 10 GB F:\ Unknown CDRom 0.00% 0.00% 0 B 0 B 0 B

dev:remarks.maml:para: Lists disk drive stats such as disk space,free used percent etc.

maml:description.maml:para: List mapped drives
Lists all mapped network drives on the local machine.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-LongMappedDrive | fl *
UncPath : \\Contoso\Share1\ DriveLetter : H:\ FileSystem : NTFS FreePercent : 11.61% UsedPercent : 88.39% Free : 5.79 GB Used : 44.11 GB Size : 49.9 GB AvailableFreeSpace : 6217994240 DriveFormat : NTFS DriveType : Network IsReady : True Name : H:\ RootDirectory : H:\ TotalFreeSpace : 6217994240 TotalSize : 53580132352 VolumeLabel : DiskSpaceInfo : H:\ DosDeviceName : H: IsDosDeviceSubstitute : False IsUnc : True IsVolume : True VolumeInfo :

dev:remarks.maml:para: Lists any mapped drives on the local machine

maml:description.maml:para: Remove a mapped drive
The name of a local device to be disconnected, such as "F:". Note: you may omit the ':' in the drive letter, e.g. F

Specifies whether the disconnection should occur if there are open files or jobs on the connection. If this parameter is false or not specified, the function fails if there are open files or jobs Warning: this may result in loss of unsaved changed so use with care.
The name of a local device to be disconnected, such as "F:". Note: you may omit the ':' in the drive letter, e.g. F

Specifies whether the disconnection should occur if there are open files or jobs on the connection. If this parameter is false or not specified, the function fails if there are open files or jobs Warning: this may result in loss of unsaved changed so use with care.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Unmounts any network share that is mounted on F:
Any open files or connections to the G drive are dropped and then the G drive is unmounted .

maml:description.maml:para: The Get-LongItem cmdlet gets the item at the specified location and not the contents of the item at the location.

Specifies the path to an item. Get-Item gets the item at the specified location. Wildcards are NOT permitted. This parameter is required, but the parameter name ("Path") is optional. Path may be relative or absolute

Specifies the path to an item. Get-Item gets the item at the specified location. Wildcards are NOT permitted. This parameter is required, but the parameter name ("Path") is optional. Path may be relative or absolute
You can pipe a string that contains a path to Get-LongItem.
For more information see: http://alphafs.alphaleonis.com/doc/2.0/api/html/C308A5E5.htm

maml:alert.maml:para: Get-LongItem does not have a Recurse parameter, because it gets only an item, not its contents. To get the contents of an item recursively, use Get-LongChildItem.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets the 'fileinfo' for the directory C:\temp. The object that is retrieved represents only the directory, not its contents.

maml:description.maml:para: Renames an item in a AlphaFS FileSystem provider namespace.
The Rename-LongItem cmdlet changes the name of a specified item. This cmdlet does not affect the content of the item being renamed.
Specifies the path to the item to rename.

Specifies the new name of the item. Enter only a name, not a path and name.
You cannot use wildcard characters in the value of NewName. To specify a name for multiple files, use the Replace operator in a regular expression. For more information about the Replace operator, type "get-help about_comparison_operators". For a demonstration, see the examples.
Allows the cmdlet to rename items that cannot otherwise be changed, such as read-only files. Warning: existing files will be replaced when used with this switch
Specifies the path to the item to rename.
Reanme only the file extension while retaining the file name.
Allows the cmdlet to rename items that cannot otherwise be changed, such as read-only files. Warning: existing files will be replaced when used with this switch
Specifies the path to the item to rename.

Specifies the new name of the item. Enter only a name, not a path and name.
You cannot use wildcard characters in the value of NewName. To specify a name for multiple files, use the Replace operator in a regular expression. For more information about the Replace operator, type "get-help about_comparison_operators". For a demonstration, see the examples.
Allows the cmdlet to rename items that cannot otherwise be changed, such as read-only files. Warning: existing files will be replaced when used with this switch
Reanme only the file extension while retaining the file name.
This cmdlet does not return any output.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command renames the file drivers.txt to d1.txt

the file 'drivers.txt' is renamed by piping the output of 'Get-LongChildItem' to Rename-LongItem. The newfilename is created by adding a prefix and a suffix to the filename resulting in the following newname: 'PrefixdriversSuffix.txt'.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-ChildItem -Path C:\temp -Filter *.txt | Rename-LongItem -NewExtension log -Confirm:$false
VERBOSE: Performing the operation "Changing Extension" on target "Item: C:\temp\d1.txt Destination: C:\temp\d1.log". VERBOSE: Rename-LongItem: C:\temp\d1.txt C:\temp\d1.log
VERBOSE: Performing the operation "Changing Extension" on target "Item: C:\temp\d2.txt Destination: C:\temp\d2.log". VERBOSE: Rename-LongItem: C:\temp\d2.txt C:\temp\d2.log

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all the text files in c:\temp and pipes them to Rename-LongItem which then renames each text file extension from *.txt to *.log Note: the name os the file is retained(in other words remains unchanged)

maml:description.maml:para:
List free or available drive letters on the local machine
Get-LongFreeDriveLetter [-Last] [<CommonParameters>]
By default this cmdlet gets the first available drive letter.
When true get the last available drive letter.
When true get the last available drive letter.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LongFreeDriveLetter -Verbose VERBOSE: Get-LongFreeDriveLetter: Listing the first free DriveLetter G

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-LongFreeDriveLetter -Last -Verbose VERBOSE: Get-LongFreeDriveLetter: Listing the Last free DriveLetter Z

maml:description.maml:para: Creates new file,folder,symboliclink or hardlink items.
The New-LongItem cmdlet creates new files or folders depending upon the parameters that are used.This cmdlet can only create filesystem items(file or folder).
Specifies the path to the location of the new item. Wildcards are NOT permitted.
Specifies whether you want to create a file or a folder.
Allows the cmdlet to create an item that writes over an existing read-only item.
Specifies the path to the location of the new item. Wildcards are NOT permitted.
Specifies whether you want to create a file or a folder.
Specifies the name of the new item. You can specify the name of the new item in the Name or Path parameter value, and you can specify the path to the new item in the Name or Path parameter value.
Allows the cmdlet to create an item that writes over an existing read-only item.
Specifies the path to the location of the new item. Wildcards are NOT permitted.
Specifies whether you want to create a file or a folder.
Allows the cmdlet to create an item that writes over an existing read-only item.
Specifies the name of the new item. You can specify the name of the new item in the Name or Path parameter value, and you can specify the path to the new item in the Name or Path parameter value.
For more information see: http://alphafs.alphaleonis.com/doc/2.0/api/html/C308A5E5.htm

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command uses the New-LongItem cmdlet to create files in two different directories. Because the Path parameter takes multiple strings, you can use it to create multiple items.
The New-LongItem cmdlet is used to create the directory tree '123'\'456' which dosent exist and then finally a text file 'hello.txt' inside the '456' directory.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-LongItem -Path c:\temp\test.txt -ItemType File -Force -Value "1st Line","2nd Line" -Encoding UTF8

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a text file named test.txt and write 2 lines separated by a line break with UTF8 encoding.
a directory named test is created in the current working directory
we use the name parameter instead of path to create a text file named test.
a symbolic link named mysymlink.txt is created for an existing file named test located at c:\temp
a symboliclink named mysymlink is created for c:\temp in the current directory. Note: since the -Force switch is used any existing symlink named mysymlink will be overwritten.
a hardlink named myhardlink is created for the existing file at c:\temp\test.txt
